qas.question: When were green and red standardized as the colors of international railroad signs?
When was the first traffic light erected?
Where were the first modern electric traffic lights erected in 1912?
Besides its association with danger, why was red chosen for traffic lights?
Who was injured by a traffic light in Salt Lake City?
When was the first modern traffic light put up in London?
Who standardized the green and red colors?
What do red lights signal in regards to a system?

context: Green can communicate safety to proceed, as in traffic lights. Green and red were standardized as the colors of international railroad signals in the <a0_0>19th century<a0_0/>. <b4_0>The first traffic light<b4_0/>, using green and red gas lamps, was erected in <a1_0>1868<a1_0/> in front of the Houses of Parliament in <b7_0>London<b7_0/>. It exploded the following year, injuring <b5_0>the policeman<b5_0/> who operated it. In <b6_0>1912<b6_0/>, the first modern electric traffic lights were put up in <a2_0>Salt Lake City, Utah<a2_0/>. Red was chosen largely because of its <a3_0>high visibility<a3_0/>, and its association with danger, while green was chosen largely because it could not be mistaken for red. Today green lights universally signal that a system is <b8_0>turned on and working<b8_0/> as it should. In many video games, green signifies both health and completed objectives, opposite red.
